alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain a carboxamide group that is N-linked to a aryl group. They have the generic structure RC(=O)N(R')H, R = organyl group and R'= aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: N-arylamides

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid amide derivatives of fatty acids, that are formed from a fatty acid and an amine.
alternative_parents.name: Fatty amides

alternative_parents.description: Carbonyl compounds with the generic formula O=C(R)C(H)C(R')=O, where R and R' can be any group.
alternative_parents.name: 1,3-dicarbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds  in which a carbonyl group is bonded to two carbon atoms R2C=O (neither R may be a hydrogen atom). Ketones that have one or more alpha-hydrogen atoms undergo keto-enol tautomerization, the tautomer being an enol.
alternative_parents.name: Ketones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as anilides. These are organic heterocyclic compounds derived from oxoacids RkE(=O)l(OH)m (l not 0) by replacing an OH group by the NHPh group or derivative formed by ring substitution.

direct_parent.description: Organic heterocyclic compounds derived from oxoacids RkE(=O)l(OH)m (l not 0) by replacing an OH group by the NHPh group or derivative formed by ring substitution.
direct_parent.name: Anilides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic heterocyclic compounds derived from oxoacids RkE(=O)l(OH)m (l not 0) by replacing an OH group by the NHPh group or derivative formed by ring substitution.
subclass.name: Anilides

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
